p: In contrast to 2015–2016 and 2016–2017, when at the beginning of the epidemic period, one of the influenza A virus subtypes (A(H1N1)pdm09 and A(H3N2), respectively) prevailed in the northern hemisphere and influenza B viruses became prevalent at the end of the season, in 2017–2018, from the very beginning of the epidemic season, joint circulation of type A and B influenza strains was observed [ 6, 8].
